cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.SI, cs.DC. 

The paper deals with the performance analysis of locally recoverable codes (LRCs) over stochastic channels, which involves concepts from information theory (IT) and coding theory (DS, CC). The paper also discusses the gap to Shannon capacity, which is a fundamental concept in IT (SI). Finally, the paper analyzes the performance of LRCs, which can be considered a distributed computing problem, falling under the category of distributed computing (DC).
